answerText: brassinosteroids [prompt on BR][10] The brassinosteroid receptors BRI1 and BAK1 contain a repeat rich in this amino acid. That repeat forms a horseshoe structure and this amino acid is also found in a namesake zipper. It is structurally like valine, but with a CH2 added after the alpha carbon.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 6 | 10 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These compounds whose synthesis pathway contains DWARF4 and det2 were first isolated in pollen collected from oilseed rape by bees. For 10 points each: [10] Name these plant hormones that simulate cell elongation, inhibit root elongation, and have a negative effect on photomorphogenesis.
